competitors.name: Vonage (formerly Nexmo)
competitors.notes: Comprehensive API suite for voice, video, verification. 1,600+ global carriers, ISO 27001 compliant. End-to-end communications solutions

competitors.name: Plivo
competitors.notes: SMS, Voice, Carrier APIs in 160+ countries. Lower pricing than Twilio (US SMS $0.0045 vs Twilio $0.0079). Free call storage and recording

competitors.name: Bandwidth
competitors.notes: Owns nationwide IP voice network in US for better quality/reliability. Processed 52+ billion call minutes in 2020. Enterprise-class APIs

competitors.name: Sinch
competitors.notes: Omnichannel messaging platform with SMS, RCS, WhatsApp support. Focus on multi-channel customer engagement

competitors.name: MessageBird (now Bird)
competitors.notes: Europe-based omnichannel platform for SMS, voice, email, WhatsApp. Strong in WhatsApp and multi-channel messaging for customer-facing platforms

competitors.name: Infobip
competitors.notes: Global omnichannel platform with enterprise-grade infrastructure. APIs for SMS, voice, WhatsApp, email, in-app messaging

context: By 2020, the CPaaS market was mature and highly competitive. Twilio faced pressure on pricing from competitors like Plivo offering 30-40% lower costs. The market evolved toward omnichannel communications (SMS, voice, WhatsApp, email) rather than single-channel solutions. Key differentiators included global carrier coverage, pricing, call quality, and ease of integration. SMBs and startups increasingly sought alternatives due to Twilio's higher costs and lack of free support. COVID-19 pandemic accelerated digital communications adoption.
